g4!! The gambit! The Bishop is usually on d6 as opposed to e7. I played this game against a young pup so I decided to play a double edge sword game.
moves.7... h6 8. Rg1 g5: Black has effectively closed the position. That's my opinion. I imagine he didn't like that Pawn spearheading his King-side position.
I didn't want Black to play e5 as I thought it would give him an advantage in terms of space and active pieces.
moves.15... Bxe5 16. dxe5 O-O-O: The pawn is now a wedge in his territory.
moves.17. O-O-O Nc5 18. Rd6 Rhf8 19. Rxd8+ Rxd: I don't know if this was a mistake or not. As PxP I couln't take the pawn-h6 as it would give black a good move with Knight e4
